title: How were medieval castles and cities constructed? How did they mix concrete? - Quora

response.answer_text: Concrete mixing was a lost art after the fall of Rome, (then “reinforced” with clay tiles or flat bricks,) ergo, it was no longer mixed, period. It was rediscovered in the later XIXc. and reinforced with then plentiful steel.

Concrete has been around much longer than the medieval castles. The Romans used concrete extensively and as a matter of fact had concrete technology that we still do not fully understand today. The fact that many of the structures are still standing and resist water better than anything we now have attests to that. So yes, they just used concrete much like we do today.
